title: Pont Saint Michel, Paris

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of oil on canvas.

credit_line: Mr. and Mrs. Martin A. Ryerson Collection
publication_history:
Art Institute, A Century of Progress: Exhibition of Painting and Sculpture, exh. cat., 2nd ed. (Chicago: Art Institute, 1933), p. 79, cat. 701, as Pont St. Michel, Paris (c. 1910).

Art Institute, A Century of Progress: Exhibition of Painting and Sculpture, exh. cat. (Chicago: Art Institute, 1934), p. 52, cat. 349, as Pont St. Michel, Paris, (c. 1910).

Marie Harriman Gallery, Les Fauves, exh. cat. (New York: Marie Harriman Gallery, 1941), n.p., cat. 9, as Le Pont Saint-Michel, Paris, ca. 1908.

James Warren Lane, “The Paintings of Albert Marquet,” Gazette des Beaux-Arts 31 (May–June 1947), pp. 184, n.p. (ill.), fig. 7, as Pont Saint-Michel. 

San Francisco Museum of Art, Marquet, 1875-1947, exh. cat. (San Francisco: Museum of Art, 1958), pp. 14 (ill.), opp. 14, cat. 28, 24, as Pont Saint Michel, Paris, c. 1910.

Art Institute, Paintings in the Art Institute of Chicago: A Catalogue of the Picture Collection (Chicago: Art Institute, 1961), pp. 294-295, as Pont Saint Michel, Paris, c. 1910.

Kunstverein in Hamburg, Albert Marquet: Gemalde, pastelle, aquarelle, zeichnungen, exh. cat. (Hamburg and Ferdiandstor: Kunstverein in Hamburg, 1965), n.p. (cat. 45), as Pont Saint-Michel, 1910.

Wildenstein, Albert Marquet, exh. cat. (New York: Wildenstein, 1971), n.p., cat. 17, as Le Pont Saint-Michel, Paris, c. 1910. 

A. James Speyer, Twentieth-Century European Paintings (Chicago: University of Chicago Press, 1980), p. 53, no. 2F2, as Pont St Michel, Paris, c. 1910.
exhibition_history:
Chicago, Art Institute, A Century of Progress: Exhibition of Painting and Sculpture, June 1–November 1, 1933, p. 79, cat. 701, as Pont St. Michel, Paris (c. 1910).

Chicago, Art Institute, A Century of Progress: Exhibition of Painting and Sculpture, June 1–November 1, 1934, p. 52, cat. 349, as Pont St. Michel, Paris, (c. 1910).

New York, Marie Harriman Gallery, Les Fauves, October 20–November 24, 1941, n.p., cat. 9, as Le Pont Saint-Michel, Paris, ca. 1908.

American Federation of the Arts (organizer), 19th Century French Paintings; traveled to Dayton, Art Institute, June 1–22, 1948; San Francisco, Legion of Honor, August 5–26, 1948; Springfield, Missouri, Art Museum, September 9–30, 1948; Poughkeepsie, Vassar College Art Gallery, October 15–November 3, 1948; Manchester, New Hampshire, November 16–December 7, 1948; Saginaw, Michigan, Museum, December 19, 1948–January 9, 1949; Omaha, Joslyn Memorial Art Museum, January 23–February 15, 1949; Memphis, Brooks Memorial Art Gallery, March 1–22, 1949; Utica, Munson-Williams-Proctor Institute, April 3–24, 1949; and Scranton, Everhart Museum, May 10–31, 1949.

San Francisco, Museum of Art, Albert Marquet, 1875-1947, May 26–July, 1958, pp. 14 (ill.), opp. 14, cat. 28, 24, as Pont Saint Michel, Paris, c. 1910; traveled to Baltimore, Museum of Art; Cincinnati, Art Museum; Utica, Munson-Williams-Proctor Institute; and Seattle, Art Museum.

Hamburg, Kunstverein, Albert Marquet: Gemalde, pastelle, aquarelle, zeichnungen, November 14, 1964–January 10, 1965, n.p. (cat. 45), as Pont Saint-Michel, 1910.

Springfield, Illinois State Museum, The Art Resources Traveler: Fauve Painting, March 5–April 24, 1966; traveled to Muscatine, Iowa, Laura Musser Art Gallery and Museum, July 24–October 2, 1966; Peoria, Lakeview Center of the Arts and Sciences, November 30–January 8, 1967. 

New York, Wildenstein and Company, Albert Marquet, October 28–December 4, 1971, n.p., cat. 17, as Le Pont Saint-Michel, Paris, c. 1910.
provenance_text: Georges Bernheim, Paris, by June 11, 1920 [this and the following according to invoice from Bernheim Jeune & Cie. to Martin A. Ryerson, June 11, 1924, copy in curatorial file]; Martin A. Ryerson, Chicago, June 11, 1924; bequeathed to the Art Institute of Chicago, Nov. 11, 1933.
copyright_notice: © 2018 Artists Rights Society (ARS), New York / ADAGP, Paris
